monogr.title: The examinacion of the constaunt martir of Christ, Ioh [a] n Philpot : archediacon of Winchestre at sondry seasons in the tyme of his sore emprisonment, conuented and banted, as in these particular tragedies folowyng, it maye (not only to the christen instruction, but also t the mery recreacion of the indifferent reader) most manifestly appeare. Reade fyrst and than iudge
monogr.author: Philpot, John

div.p: BEcause I haue begonne to write vnto you, of myne examinacions before the B. & other, more to satisfie your desire, than it is any thing worthy to be written: I haue thought yt good, to write vnto you also, that which hath ben of late, that the same myght come to light, which they do in darkenes & priuy corners, and that the world nowe & the posteritie herafter might knowe, howe vnorderlye, vniustlye, and vnlearnedlye, these rauening wolues do procede agaynst the selye and faithful flocke of Christ: and condēpne and persecute the syncere doctrine of Christ in vs, which they are not hable (by honest meanes) to resyst, but only by tyrannie, and violence.
